thread.title: Powerful headwinds hit profits at Lloyd’s of London
thread.title_full: Powerful headwinds hit profits at Lloyd’s of London

title: Powerful headwinds hit profits at Lloyd’s of London
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Powerful headwinds hit profits at Lloyd’s of London Lloyd’s syndicates will have to pay out after the explosions in Tianjin, in China, last month Geno Li/EPA Google+ 1 of 1 Lloyd’s syndicates will have to pay out after the explosions in Tianjin, in China, last month Geno Li/EPA Katherine Griffiths Banking Editor Last updated at 12:01AM, September 11 2015 
The Lloyd’s of London insurance market will have a tough second half of the year as it struggles with a difficult economic environment and a flood of capital that is depressing premiums, its chairman has warned. 
Continuing low interest rates will hurt investment returns and fierce competition will make it difficult to underwrite profitably, John Nelson said. These headwinds started to be felt in the first half and will continue in the next six months, he said. 
Lloyds suffered a 28 per cent drop in first-half pre-tax profits to £1.19 billion. The market’s combined ratio — a measure of profitability showing Subscribe now
